Donald Rumsfeld concludes in his new autobiography that the war in Iraq has been worth the cost and remains largely unapologetic about his handling of the conflict. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today , Mr Donald Rumsfeld wrote in his memoir, due out next week. Mr Donald Rumsfeld and other US officials cited the threat posed by Iraqi weapons of ADVERTISEMENT mass destruction as justification for the 2003 US-led invasion.
